message.content: This command allows you to connect to an Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) instance using Secure Shell (SSH). The `ssh` command is used to establish a secure connection between your local machine and the remote server, while the `-i "~/UserKey.pem"` option specifies the location of the private key file that will be used for authentication. The `-C` flag enables compression to improve the speed of data transfer, and the `-L 25900:localhost:5900` option sets up a port forwarding rule that redirects traffic from your local machine's port 25900 to the instance's port 5900. This is useful if you want to access a service running on the remote server, such as a web server or database, using a client application on your local machine. The `user` and `ec2-34-21-131-108.us-west-2.compute.amazonaws.com` are placeholders for the username and IP address of the EC2 instance you want to connect to, respectively.
